page.title: 06Housing Patterns In Woolton
page.content: 100 years ago, Woolton housing consisted of small{terraced}workmen's {cottages}and large detached residences for the affluent. The release of the Salisbury estate in the 1930's, led to the present emphasis on 'middle class' housing. A large area of the village consists of comfortable{detached and {semi-detached houses of character}with fairly large gardens, garages and large airy rooms. Small areas of terraced, council owned property has been recently renovated and modernised. Some small {council houses}have been built lately. Worker's cottages are gradually being demolished and smart{sheltered {housing}for the aged and infirm is beginning to appear. Large detached period houses are built higher up the hill for the more affluent. G.T.RAWLINSON
